books.info: Mr Francis D'Souza, Deputy Chief Minister of Goa (India), speaks at the release of Konkani novel "Sankoll" written by Goa's top ranking novelist Bonaventure D'Pietro, at the Goa State Museum Hall, Panjim, on May 4, 2013. D'Pietro, who hails from Anjuna, has written 18 books so far and this well researched book deals with all the rare traditions and rites of Catholic weddings in Goa.

books.author: Recorded by Frederick Noronha (FN)
books.info: Ugtem Molob (Open Skies, in Konkani) is the name of the event. Each month, at 5 pm on the last Saturday of the month, a small but dedicated group of Konkani poetry enthusiasts meets at the Tristao Braganca Cunha Hall in Panjim (near Azad Maidan) to share their poetry. Here is one live recording from November 2017. Amidst all the Konkani, there's even a little Portuguese here!
books.tag: konkani,poetry,goa,ugtem molob,monthly poetry recitals in goa,panjim,panaji,goa,india
books.title: Ugtem Molob, Konkani poetry (November 2017)

books.info: A recitation of Konkani poems from Goa inspired by village environment featuring  Ramesh  Ghadi and others, organised at 11 am, on  Sunday, February 4, 2018 at the Musuem of Goa (MOG), Pilerne Industrial Estate.  The programme was  organised under the MOG Sundays in association with Poetry Prism and Goa Union of Journalists. Participating poets include: Shashikant Punaji,  Amey Naik,  Rupali Mauzo Kirtani (video recording),  Devidas Gaokar (video recording),  Santosh Harmalkar, e vam (and)   Ramesh  Ghadi.   ...  एवं   रमेश !

books.author: Recorded from Goa Tiatr Academy programme on Rainbow AIR FM
books.info: Each month, the Tiatr Academy of Goa [ http://www.tiatracademygoa.com ]  remembers the Konkani  tiatrists (stage actors) of another era, and pays tributes to them via radio on the last Saturday of each month currently (2017). This is a monthly programme broadcast on AIR FM Rainbow from Panjim, Goa.  Those remembered in this particularly (recorded) programme are Bai Rosaria Rodrigues (b. 1968), Seby Coutinho (b. 1929), Prem Kumar (d. 2007), Filomena Braz, Peter D'Costa of Colva, Star of Arossim , Khada Minguel, and the famed Remy Colaco. Bai Rosario was a child artist. Seby Coutinho was called the 'Pran' of Konkani tiatr . Prem Kumar (aka Pedro Xavier D'Costa of Chandor) was known for his innovation on the Konkani stage. He produced 55 tiatrs , and brought on the revolving stage to Konkani drama and even, at one time, managed to depict a train on stage. Filomena Braz acted in the tiatr of Alfred Rose and other greats. Braz's music can still be heard on the local radio even today. Peter D'Costa of Colva was a song writer and tiatr actor. He is known for songs like Sao Joao, Bhirmott , etc. Star of Arossim was the stage-name of Alegre Antao, who began participating in the tiatr from the age of 13 at Majorda. Arossim is a small but scenic village along the Mormugao coast. Remy Colaco is still known for his voice, and some of his plays include Satvo Sakrament (The Seventh Sacrament). He was a good writer who focussed on family themes and politics too. He was a voracious reader too. An interesting programme of talk and music. Useful to listen to spoken (Christian-dialect) Konkani, learn a bit of the language, and also familiarise yourself with the charming old world music from the region of Goa, a former Portuguese colony, capital of Lisbon's empire in the east, and now India's smallest state.
books.tag: theatre,goa,tiatrists,konkani,konkani stage,remembering,tributes,remy colaco,prem kumar,star of arossim
books.title: Remembering Tiatrists: Prem Kumar, Star of Arossim, Remy Colaco...
books.authorUrl: https://archive.org/search.php?query=creator%3ARecorded from Goa Tiatr Academy programme on Rainbow AIR FM

books.info: 꿈밤 첫번째 게스트 '댄서 김승현 씨'를 소개합니다 창업비 0원. 그러니까 무일푼 창업이죠. 자 무일푼 창업으로 6개월만에 매출 1억을 찍었다. 어디 뉴스 속에서나, 동화 속에서나 나오는 얘기 같네요. 아니 사업하려면 초기 자금 한 1억은 있어야 하는 거 아닌가? 하는 생각도 드는데, 여기 현실과 꿈 사이에서 자신만의 이야기를 써내려가는 이가 있습니다. '재밌는 일'로 '먹고 살 용기'를 낸 이 언니. 의미있는 일에, 가치 있는 일에 아낌 없는 열정을 쏟고 있는 이를 꿈밤에 모십니다. 이분 심지어 예쁩니다. 회사를 그만두고 10가지 버킷리스트 중 5개를 이뤘다는 그녀. 꿈밤의 두번째 게스트, 종합마케팅 회사 배은지 셜록 대표를 모십니다.

books.author: Recorded by FN
books.info: The Goa Book Club (on Googlegroups) this month  held "A One-Hour Freestyle Open Unconference on Konkani" which they called Mogacho Maand: Konknnicho Avaz. This was held along with the HIMKO, Hindi-Marathi and Konkani Club of the Dempo College. Promoted by engineer Jose Lourenco and Augusto Pinto, the idea was to "listen to the varied voices, accents and dialects of Konkani". Participants were invited to bring along a very short story or poem or folktale or novel excerpt and read it out ("in a dull monotone, or a dramatic act or something in between"). Pednem, Xashti, and a range of other variants could be heard, including voices from deep down in Cabo da Rama. A recording of the programme.

books.author: Recorded by Frederick Noronha. Sung by respective performers.
books.info: Mandeachi Sanz, an evening of mando, was organised at the Saligao Institute on December 27, 2019 (Friday) from 6 pm onwards. Tomazinho and Irene Cardozo were the guests of honour. Nicholas Sequeira introduced the mando theme. There were performances by the Mando Mogui (adults, traditional) led by Merlyn Francis; the Saligao Mando Rockers (children's, traditional) led by Vallon and Alia Fernandes, Salganvche Songita Ixtt (traditional) led by Simon Fernandes and directed by Orland Vaz with Rebecca on violin, Ruth on guitar and Divesh on the ghumot (the traditional Goan percussion instrument). This was preceded by the felicitation of mando trainers Clara Sequeira, Nina Monteiro Mendonça, Philomena D'Souza,  Nicholas Sequeira, Diego Fernandes. The Saligão Village Community presented Sobit Saligão. This original mando composed by Estaquinho Mistir , the much-remembered village music teacher, and Fr. Roberto Vaz in the 1970s. The evening ended with a spontaneous singalong of mandde and dulpodam by all.
books.title: Mandeachi Sanz, an evening of the mando at the Saligão Institute
books.authorUrl: https://archive.org/search.php?query=creator%3ARecorded by Frederick Noronha. Sung by respective performers.

books.author: Recorded by FN
books.info: A recording from the Dalgado Konknni Akademi-organised Borovpeak Bhett (Meet the Writer) Programme on Wednesday, October 30, 2013 at TAG Hall, Campal, Panjim, Goa at 4.30 pm.  The personality for the Borovpeak Bhett is Enclidas de Elly, publisher and editor of Cine Times, a Konkani weekly published from Mumbai. Walter Menezes comments: "He was born in Bombay (now Mumbai), the fourth child in a family of seven.  His mother always filled his heart with abundant love, especially of Goa, his homeland, and Konknni, the language of his forefathers.  After his studies in Delhi, he returned back to Bombay and spent 32 long and fruitful years in the cause of the mother-tongue his mother taught him." De Elly was the editor of the Konkani weekly *Cine Times*.
books.tag: media,india,bombay,konkani weekly,cine times,newspapers of the past
books.title: Enclidas de Elly: Editing the Konkani Cine Times

books.author: Aradhon Choir conducted by Omar do Loiola Pereira
books.info: Konkani Hymns of Goa Revisited. Sung by the Aradhon Choir, conducted by Omar de Loiola Pereira. Presented by Funda ç ã o Oriente Museu. A live recording at the Monte Music Festival 2018, at the Chapel of Our Lady of the Mount, Old Goa, Goa, India. The programme for this concert lays emphasis on Konkani Christian music in Goa. A few hymns in other languages were also added in order to celebrate Goa's linguistic diversity. Konkani Christian music in Goa is incredibly rich,  not only in its theological content but also in its musicality. If, on the one hand, its lyrics are most often written by members of the clergy, giving these pieces significant theological substance, on the other hand, its music is composed either by priests or laymen with a significant musical background. Aradhon attempts to approach these compositions from a different angle. These hymns are sung regularly in churches across Goa and therefore their melodies are, to a large extent, left unchanged, so that the congregation can join in. A new music perspective is given by creating vocal and instrumental arrangements around the melody. In this performance: * Sam Francisku Xaviera, by Raimundo Barreto * Ekloch Amcho Somi, Vasco do Rego SJ & anon. * Ruzari Saibinni, traditional * Mari Mateak Ballok Zala, by Manohar Sardessai and Micael Martins * Onod Mhoima, by Lino de S á  and Bernardo Cota * Pie Jesu, by A L Webber * Devacho Sobd Tum, by Lino de S á  and Bernardo Cota * O Santissima, traditional * Panis Angelicus, by Cesar Franck * Tujea Hatant Mhozo Hat, by Vasco do Rego SJ and Tom á s d'Aquino Sequeira * Dev Zata Monxeachem Khann, by Vasco do Rego SJ & Alc á ntara Barros * Sangatam Cholum-ia, by Tom á s d'Aquino Sequeira * Maie Kakutin Bhorlole, traditional * An Irish Blessing, by Bob Chilcott * O Happy Day, Gospel Music Standard Credits:  * Omar de Loiola Pereira, musical director, guitarist and baritone * Fleur Anne Dias, soprano * Anushka Coutinho, soprano * Efigenia de Santana Miranda, soprano * Heidi Loiola Pereira, alto * Nisha Carvalho Costa, alto * Ravi Carvalho, tenor * Dylan Carvalho, tenor * Gino Collaco, tenor and keyboard

books.author: Jock Sequeira and Team
books.info: Sukh Anim Duk (Joy and Sorrow). Songs of Goan Life. Recorded by Jock Sequeira and Team, probably in the 1950s or thereabouts. Copy received by FN from Mervyn Maciel. Lyrics by Jock Sequeira. Vocalists: Jock Sequeira, Sibila Pinto, Mervyn Maciel. Musicians: Adolfo Saldanha (violin), Alfredo Figueiredo (Portuguese guitar), Denzyl Sequeira (guitar) and Derrick Sequeira (keyboards).
